storage.item: Fridge: 3-4 days in parchment, reheat in pan

instructions.instruction: Blend greens: Add spinach, cilantro, garlic, and 1/4 cup water to blender. Blend until smooth green paste forms.
Grind oats: In food processor, pulse oats until they form fine flour consistency.
Make dough: Mix oat flour, green paste, and cumin. Add water gradually until soft, pliable dough forms.
Rest: Let dough rest 10 minutes covered with damp cloth.
Roll & cook: Divide into 4-6 balls. Roll thin, cook in hot pan 1-2 minutes per side until spotted.

tips.item: Freezes perfectly! Portion in mason jars, leave 1" headspace
Reheat tip: Microwave from frozen or thaw overnight
Beginner tip: Don't let garlic burn - just 30 seconds!

instructions.instruction: Heat oil: In large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat for 1 minute.
Cook vegetables: Add onion, carrots, celery. Cook 5-7 minutes until onion looks clear.
Add garlic: Add minced garlic, cook 30 seconds until fragrant (don't burn!).
Add broth & chicken: Pour in broth, bring to boil. Add chicken and seasonings.
Make creamy: Whisk milk with cream cheese, slowly stir into soup.
Add greens: Stir in spinach, cook 2 minutes until wilted. Taste and adjust seasoning.

tips.item: Spices: 1/2 tsp cumin, 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/4 tsp chili powder
Freezes perfectly! Cool completely before freezing
Serving tip: Add fresh Greek yogurt when reheating

instructions.instruction: Heat & sauté: Heat oil, cook onion 5 minutes until clear and soft.
Add aromatics: Add garlic (30 seconds), then chiles and spices (1 minute).
Add beans & broth: Add white beans and broth, bring to boil.
Simmer with chicken: Add chicken, reduce heat, simmer 15 minutes.
Make creamy: Whisk cream cheese with milk, stir into chili.
Serve: Season to taste, top with Greek yogurt instead of sour cream!

tips.item: Perfect with: Rotisserie chicken, crackers, or as yogurt mix-in
Storage: Keeps 1 week in fridge - flavors get better!
Freeze tip: Freeze in ice cube trays for portion control

instructions.instruction: Prep cranberries: Roughly chop fresh cranberries (or pulse in food processor 3-4 times).
Dice vegetables: Finely dice bell pepper and onion into small, uniform pieces.
Prep jalapeño: Cut in half, remove seeds with spoon, mince finely (wash hands after!).
Make dressing: In small bowl, whisk lime juice, honey, chili powder, and salt.
Combine: Mix all ingredients, pour dressing over, stir well.
Let flavors meld: Rest 15 minutes before serving for best flavor!

dressing.item: 1/4 tsp sea salt + pinch black pepper

instructions.instruction: Prep beets: Roast whole beets at 400°F for 45 minutes until tender. Cool, peel, spiralize.
Make dressing: Whisk all dressing ingredients together in small bowl.
Spiralize carrot: Use spiralizer or vegetable peeler to create ribbon strips.
Arrange beautifully: Place greens in bowl, arrange beet and carrot spirals in alternating rings.
Finish & serve: Sprinkle seeds in center, add chicken, drizzle dressing just before eating.

tips.item: Freeze hack: Freeze in ice cube trays for instant green boost
Kombucha mix: Add to your favorite kombucha for probiotic power
Post-workout: Perfect for after Chloe Ting workouts

instructions.instruction: Blend greens: Add spinach, kale, cucumber, and water to blender. Blend until smooth.
Strain (optional): Pour through fine mesh strainer for ultra-smooth texture.
Add flavor: Stir in lemon juice, honey, and chlorella powder until dissolved.
Serve fresh: Pour over ice, top with sparkling water for fizzy version.
Storage: Keeps 2 days in fridge - stir before drinking!

coatings.item: Mexican Lime Chili: Lime juice + chili powder
Lemon Drop: Lemon juice + stevia + cinnamon
Ginger Lime: Ginger powder + lime juice
Vanilla Dreams: Vanilla extract + monk fruit

instructions.instruction: Prep fruit: Wash and dry grapes and cranberries completely (wet fruit won't coat well).
Choose coating: Pick your mood - sweet, spicy, or tart. Mix coating ingredients in small bowl.
Coat fruit: Toss fruit with coating mixture until evenly covered.
Freeze single layer: Spread on parchment-lined baking sheet, freeze 2-3 hours.
Store & enjoy: Transfer to freezer bags. Grab whenever you need a sweet fix!

tips.item: Sweet cravings: Satisfies dessert urges with minimal calories
Spicy-sweet mood: Unique flavor combination hits all taste buds
Pre-workout: Natural energy boost without sugar crash

instructions.instruction: Mix ingredients: In small bowl, stir cranberry sauce, chili powder, and lime juice until combined.
Fill trays: Spoon mixture into ice cube trays, filling each compartment about 3/4 full.
Freeze solid: Freeze for at least 3 hours or overnight until completely solid.
Pop & store: Remove from trays, store in freezer bags for up to 3 months.
Enjoy: Pop one cube when you need a sweet-spicy treat!
